title: "Leak" Present in the Excursion Funnel Test Element

labels.name: Duplicate
labels.description: This issue has already been reported

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

4.42.0

### BEE2 Package Version

4.42.0

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 10 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

Whenever loading I am loading a test chamber with the inclusion of the excursion funnel, I find the model to be completely voided out. It goes completely white, almost as if it there was a "leak" in the map. Sometimes it works fine while other times the model  preventing the leak cannot be found. One thing to note is that the excursion funnel still works as expected, it is just the model of the element that is the problem. Below is the screenshot taken in game:
![20230329210616_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99097022/228703419-082b6c0a-5e76-49ac-a324-d35f2e8bcf28.jpg)

In addition, I will also provide the chamber link in case anyone asks:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UgscWRoAoybv7upmmgY7X2bUO80PwA_B/view?usp=sharing

### Expected behavior

I expected the model for the excursion funnel to stay loaded in to prevent the "leak" from occuring; nevertheless, it did not turn out as previously expected.

### Steps to reproduce

N/A


### Logs and Reports

title: Coop error display eventually kicks to menu with "partner has disconnected"

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body: The error display map lacks any Coop specific entities, so after a minute or two the game will kick the player back to the main menu (*not the puzzlemaker*) with the "your partner has disconnected" message. To fix this, the map needs to contain a pair of `info_coop_spawn`s for each player and call the `AddBranchLevelName` VScript function at least once (this will also allow the players to move around). I'd also recommend adding an `env_global` that sets the spawn without portalgun global state, and a client or server command entity that sets `ss_force_primary_fullscreen 1` so the message can appear in the center of the screen (it resets on every map load/respawn, so this won't break splitscreen later). I'd also recommend changing the message to display instantly with no fade.

title: Preview error pointfile named differently from main map

labels.name: Compiler
labels.description: Issue pertains to the custom BEE compilers

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body: When a leak occurs, the map is renamed to `preview.error.vmf` but the pointfile is renamed to `preview.bee2.lin`, resulting in Hammer not auto-detecting it and asking to select it manually.

title: Blank instance filenames break when used in <> replacements

labels.name: Compiler
labels.description: Issue pertains to the custom BEE compilers

body: If an extra custom instance is set in `editoritems.txt` to a blank filename, attempting to use it in a condition using the `<>` system will result in the instance path instead getting set to a single period. These instances don't get removed from the map like actual blank filename instances do, causing compile errors.

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

4.42.0

### BEE2 Package Version

4.42.0

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 10 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

While I was creating a test chamber to post onto the steam workshop, I tried to play the preview and noticed that certain flat walls were placed in weird areas that stopped progression. In addition, the goo covered floor was removed and replaced with a singular texture that was made up of said walls. This has never happened before and has just started. Here is the original chamber in the editor compared to the preview.
**Editor:** 
![20221213133025_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99097022/207417489-c15ca6f1-ceb1-41ea-8ca0-b3965a2e2b6e.jpg)
**In game:**
![20221213133033_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99097022/207417481-6a535701-0ff6-421b-b3a2-00d0aea22fb1.jpg)

### Expected behavior

After rebuilding the chamber and playing it, I expected it to be exactly what the editor showed. Instead, it would replace elements with flat walls and overall, make the puzzle impossible to complete. 

### Steps to reproduce

As much as it doesn't help, I'm unsure on what is causing this bug to take effect. Like mentioned before, it just started taking place and hasn't happened before hand when using Beemod. 

### Logs and Reports

_No response_

### Additional information

The chamber uses clean style and uses these elements:
![20221213134057_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99097022/207417947-3918d8b9-6781-4cb3-be7a-104bd389da7b.jpg)

On some instances,  as some elements are put into the chamber, everything seems normal; however, other times it ends up like the image shown in the description of the bug. In a way, it comes and goes when it feels like it.

### BEE2 Application Version

4.42.0 Beta 2

### BEE2 Package Version

4.42.0 Beta 2

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 7 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

The app will crash if you click on any of the buttons that have three dots symbol (...) located on the exporting panel options as shown in screenshot:

![Screenshot N°2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/188294486-d4fff1e6-cd04-4a6a-b928-a6b7f66c3653.png)

Once the crash message is produced and you click on "accept", the app will throw a second crash message similar to the previous one but with a little bit more of info:
![Screenshot N°3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/188294542-c25eb2b0-9d2a-4de5-b664-554acfec7566.png)




### Expected behavior

The buttons from the application should work fine when clicked.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the exporting panel options.
2. Click on any of the buttons that have the three dots symbol (...)
3. The application will crash.

```shell
Shown in the crash message of the two screenshots from above.

luke/p1_corridors_polishing

Stylevars defined in the packages (rather than in code) do not save their value across restarts, or save/load from palettes.

They should save

title: Portal2.fgd missing boolean defaults

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

BEE2.4.41.0 64bit

### BEE2 Package Version

BEE2.4.41.0

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 10 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

1. Uninstalled BEE2.4.36.0/1 from Portal 2.
2. Verified the Local Portal 2 files - successfully ( 2 files downloaded )
3. Deleted all BEE2.4.36.0/1 files from its repository folder. 
4. Ran Hammer.  It did not get any errors.  Closed Hammer.
5. Unpacked the BEE2.4.41.0 : program files, items and music packages to their repository folder.
6. Ran the BEE2.exe then exported BEE2 to Portal 2.
7. Ran Hammer and got the following errors:

File E:\Steam\steamapps\common\Portal 2\bin\portal2.fgd, line 2301: boolean type specified with nonsensical default value:
File E:\Steam\steamapps\common\Portal 2\bin\portal2.fgd, line 2474: boolean type specified with nonsensical default value:

Used Notepad++ to look at the Portal 2.fgd
The first error was in the code block for:  @SolidClass = comp_trigger_coop
And the line above  the stated line# was missing a default:
    nodamageforces(boolean) : "No damage forces?"
The 2nd error was in the code block for:  @SolidClass = comp_trigger_p2_goo
And once again the line above  the stated line# was missing a default:
    nodamageforces(boolean) : "No damage forces?"
    
Updated the fgd to include the defaults of 0 (zero) for both of those entries, and restarted Hammer, but the errors shifted down several lines in the fgd. Looking through the rest of the fgd showed lots of booleans missing defaults.

### Expected behavior

I expect Hammer to not get any errors when BEE2.4.x is installed and exported to Portal2.

### Steps to reproduce

Do everything stated in the description. 

### Logs and Reports

```shell
File E:\Steam\steamapps\common\Portal 2\bin\portal2.fgd, line 2301: boolean type specified with nonsensical default value:
File E:\Steam\steamapps\common\Portal 2\bin\portal2.fgd, line 2474: boolean type specified with nonsensical default value:
I
```


### Additional information

I'm using the Overgrown style.

title: Tooltips from the item properties are no longer entirely visible

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issue pertains to the BEE2.4 user interface

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

4.41.0

### BEE2 Package Version

4.41.0

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 7 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

The main purpose of the small icons that are present in the item properties window, is that when you mouse-hover on them, a tooltip would appear to identify/clarify what those icons means (because most people do not have idea what those icons are meant to represent). However, since the item properties window now renders over everything, their tooltips are no longer visible, unfortunately. 

So, if this tooltip issue is not really fixable, I suggest to get rid of those small icons because they would be useless without the tooltip not being entirely visible.

Here are some pictures showing what I mean:

1:
![Icon´s tooltips from the item properties are no longer visible, which makes these icons actually useless 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/145756063-ad4b3028-3821-4458-bf62-624925b80aef.png)
2:
![Icon´s tooltips from the item properties are no longer visible, which makes these icons actually useless 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/145756081-b396d8b6-4e2d-4cd1-88a4-132696782893.png)
3:
![Icon´s tooltips from the item properties are no longer visible, which makes these icons actually useless 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/145756099-4685484c-6935-4304-814c-54fa6835ff32.png)




### Expected behavior

The tooltips from the BEEmod user interface must be visible.

### Steps to reproduce

Deploy the item properties window by doing right-click on an item from the BEEmod palette, then do mouse-hover in any of their small icons that are present in this window, you will notice that their tooltips are no longer entirely visible and in some cases it would not appear at all.

### Logs and Reports

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

### BEE2 Application Version

Dev

Dev

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 10 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

The compiler does not properly recognize non-reversible funnels when generating funnel lighting. As a result:
- All funnels generate both dynamic lights, even when they don't need them because they never reverse or turn off
- Disabling the *Light Reversible Excursion Funnels* stylevar disables funnel lighting entirely

### Expected behavior

Non-reversible funnels should be recognized, and only generate static lights.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Disable *Light Reversible Excursion Funnels*
2. Export and open Portal 2
3. Place a funnel with no inputs
4. Compile the map
5. The funnel has no lighting

title: [dev] Item properties window goes rendering behind the main window after user tries to "Change defaults"

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
### BEE2 App version:  
dev (latest pull, should be the same version as RC2)  
### BEE2 Packages version:
dev (latest pull, should be the same version as the one that is to be used with app RC2)
### OS:
Windows 10 64-bit

### Description of the bug:
It is possible to make item properties window start rendering behind the main window, if you activated "Change defaults" window. The following video is a demonstration of the bug and how to achieve it

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86309764/140644271-b404e5e5-58ed-4fe6-9d71-7fcb5b985b0b.mp4

Nasty thing is that then item properties window is seemingly impossible to bring back on top, i tried:
* clicking on window
* clicking on other windows
* minimizing and restoring back the application
* clicking again on the button "Change defaults"
* restarting application  <-- the only thing that worked

### Expected behavior
Item properties window should _always_ render on top of main window

### Steps to reproduce 
1. Launch BEE2.4
2. Right-click on any item to bring up item properties 
3. Click on "Change defaults" button
4. Close the "Change defaults" window
5. Right-click on any item
6. See that item properties window renders behind main window
  
You can watch the attached video to see how its done.

### Logs
Nothing

### Additional Info
Nothing

### BEE2 Application Version

RC2 32bit

### BEE2 Package Version

RC1

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 7 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

After having selected a Style by doing double-click on it, the Style button will remain with the appearance of when it was selected:

![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/140642802-c85d6422-0f75-4a4e-8448-1affc0b58b99.png)

The buttons from the styles panel after selectiong one doing double-click on it, must not remain as if they are selected.

title: python39.dll requires missing library

labels.name: App Crash
labels.description: Something is causing the app to crash

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

4.40.2

### BEE2 Package Version

4.40.0

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 7 (64bit)

### Logs and Reports

```shell
(Screenshots have logs, but I guess this section doesn't render them, so pasting reports here)
The program archive currently comes without `api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll` library, which is getting required by `python39.dll` loader (1st screenshot).
If I download this file from any website and place it in the BEEMod/ and BEEMod/compiler/ directories, it does not fix the issue either (2nd screenshot).
```


### Additional information

Without `api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71347607/132998151-f0e3d656-5941-4d00-aaf2-d8bf686fd48c.png)
>Program launch is not possible, because api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll
is missing on this device. Try to reinstall the program.

With `api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71347607/132998181-73ed38f7-6551-4d99-a683-05b4c9d8542b.png)
>No error messages generated.
FormatMessageW: The argument is set incorrectly.

I noticed that all built-in libraries are about 10-20 KB in size, meanwhile `api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll`'s size is only 3 KB.
I also tried to un-dll it using free version of a decompiler, and it said the library is corrupted.

### BEE2 Application Version

Dev

Dev

### Description of the bug

If the first item defined in an `editoritems.txt` file has no subtypes with `Palette` blocks, the app will crash on startup with `Exception: Item <ITEM_ID> has no visible subtypes!`.

TeamSpen said on Discord that this should work correctly, and just make the item not appear on palettes.

Items with no visible subtypes should not appear on palettes, but still export and load if already placed in maps.

title: Can't add newlines or spaces between main description and style descriptions

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
### BEE2 Application Version

Dev

### BEE2 Package Version

Dev

### What operating system are you running on?

Windows 10 (64bit)

### Description of the bug

BEE2 seems to strip spaces and newlines from the start and end of descriptions. Since the only ways to force newlines in markdown are to end a line in two spaces or leave a blank line in between, this results in it being impossible to have a newline or even a space between the main description and style description, which looks pretty bad.

### Expected behavior

The normal methods of producing newlines should work between the main description and style description. Additionally, starting a line with a bullet point should automatically force a newline, regardless of whether the above methods are used.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to any item's `info.txt` entry, and add a double space at the end of the last description line.
2. Launch BEE2 and open the item's context menu
3. There is no newline between the main description and style description

### Logs and Reports

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

**Description of the bug:** In the latest dev versions, the base track of the music doesn't play. Most layer tracks also don't work, but a few do (such Wheatley and PeTI gel tracks).

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior:** The music should play.


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->

title: Dev: Some music tracks do not appear

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
<!--
If this is your first time opening an issue here, please read the contributing guidelines (there's a link below this text box). Remember:
- Make sure you're in the right place - item or style issues should go on BEE2-items
- Perform a search to make sure this issue hasn't already been reported
- Do not use the issue tracker to ask questions
- Issues should not be combined, unless they are very closely related (e.g. two bugs with a specific item in a specific case)
-->

<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**BEE2 version:** Dev

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug:** The music track selectors appear to be randomly missing music. I haven't noticed any specific pattern to which tracks are missing, but it is consistent across relaunches. With default packages, the full list of missing base tracks are:
- All Aperture Tag music
- 9999999 (1 and 2), Laser Dance, Ghost Stories, Redemption
- The Reunion 1 and 2, Vit Order 1 and 2
- Rattmann 1, Technical Difficulties, There She Is
- Robo Room 6
- All P1 music except Jiggle Bone and Subject Name Here
- All Portal Pro music
- Acceleration, Adjacency, Aperture Central, Firestorm, Halted Production, Interfacing, Junkyard, Junkyard Offices, Out of Order 1 and 2, Testing Begins, Waking to Science
- Comedy = T + T, Rattmann 2, I'm Different, Love as a Construct
- All Rexaura music
- Frankenturrets, OMG What Has He Done, Space Phase
All of these tracks appear in 4.40 and no changes have been made to the music packages since then, so this seems to be an issue with the app.

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior:** All of the music should appear.


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open the base music selector
2. Try to select any of the tracks listed above
3. You can't because they aren't in there.

- Perform a search to make sure this issue hasn't already been reported

- Issues should not be combined, unless they are very closely related (e.g. two bugs with a specific item in a specific case)
-->

<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**BEE2 version:** Dev

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug:** Selector windows consistently default to a very small size which is not usable. In previous versions, the starting size was inconsistent, but never this small.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19228201/127783587-7ec27c4c-776c-4deb-b1b8-f84d859fb3ef.png)

**Expected behavior:** Selector windows should default to a reasonably large size, with enough room to display 3 columns of items plus the description and OK/Cancel buttons.


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce:** Just open a selector window. Since the sizes are now saved, this may only apply the first time you open one and not after that, so just delete the saved window sizes from `config.vdf` to trigger this.

title: Sounds don't play at all (4.40.2)

labels.name: Duplicate
labels.description: This issue has already been reported

body:
**BEE2 version: 4.40.2**


**Description of the bug:**
Sound doesn't play at all.


<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior:**
Sound to play



**Steps to reproduce:**
Open Bee2, open a part that should have sound

title: Custom high velocity/orange gel music imported using BMMC2 not working after exporting and compiling the chamber
body:
<!--
If this is your first time opening an issue here, please read the contributing guidelines (there's a link below this text box). Remember:
- Make sure you're in the right place - item or style issues should go on BEE2-items
- Perform a search to make sure this issue hasn't already been reported
- Do not use the issue tracker to ask questions
- Issues should not be combined, unless they are very closely related (e.g. two bugs with a specific item in a specific case)
-->

<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**BEE2 version: 4.40.2**

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug: When I add high velocity/orange gel music using BMMC2 and export a palette with that music, no music plays when I'm at extreme speeds.**


<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior: The imported high velocity/orange gel music should play when needed, not _NEVER_.**


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce: 1.Make a music package using BMMC2. 2.Export it to your BEE2. 3.Use that music in a palette and export. 4.Build a chamber. 5.Compile it. (F9) 6. Place a portal on the floor and on the ceiling and enter the "infini-fling"(infinite fling) or put some orange gel on the floor and run on it. 7.You will not hear the set high velocity/orange gel music.**


<!-- Provide any console errors that appear, and screenshots or videos of the bug -->
**Additional information: Since this isn't an in-game error, I don't have any console messages or BEE2 logs. I'm sorry.**

title: Music preview does not appear.

labels.name: Duplicate
labels.description: This issue has already been reported

body:
I was using the newest version of Beemod, 4.40, when I encountered this bug.

Upon going to the music selection page, I could not preview the music in the way it was possible in older versions of Beemod.  The play button that allows you to hear the music wasn’t there.  After troubleshooting with some people in the discord, I was advised to install all runtime installers.  Installing them did not solve the problem.  I then restarted my computer.  This did not fix it either.

I expected to be able to preview the music for a chamber with the small play button next to the title of the track.

I’m not sure if it's possible to reproduce this bug.  For most people, it seems to work fine.  Spen told me it should be fixed and I haven’t seen anyone else with the problem.

A screenshot of the music selection screen showing how the play button does not appear: 

![Screenshot 2021-07-02 181000](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52897089/124332945-cdbd2300-db60-11eb-9738-8da668757611.png)

title: Creates issues with puzzlemaker_export
body:
<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**4.39.1**

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug: Several different items do not export properly, because they link to an instance that doesn't exist. Other items, such as vactubes, are not processed correctly and thus are incomplete and broken.**


<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior: To export like vanilla PTI**


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce: **

- Create a test chamber with some of the BEEMOD items(slopes, vactubes, windows, almost anything)
- Build to make sure it works normally
- use `puzzlemaker_export` to create a vmf
- open in hammer and compile
- disaster


<!-- Provide any console errors that appear, and screenshots or videos of the bug -->
**Additional information: These errors are fixable by removing all broken instances in Hammer. This may leave the level incomplete.**

title: Animations in editoritems gets exported as Sounds

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
<!--
If this is your first time opening an issue here, please read the contributing guidelines (there's a link below this text box). Remember:
- Make sure you're in the right place - item or style issues should go on BEE2-items
- Perform a search to make sure this issue hasn't already been reported
- Do not use the issue tracker to ask questions
- Issues should not be combined, unless they are very closely related (e.g. two bugs with a specific item in a specific case)
-->

<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**BEE2 version:** Dev

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug:** The `Animations` block of subtypes gets exported as `Sounds`. This causes cube and dropper animations to break, though they still work correctly in-game.


<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior:** `Animations` should export as `Animations`


<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open `packages/valve/test_elements/items/cube/editoritems.txt`
2. `Animations` block is present
3. Export
4. Open `portal2_dlc2/scripts/editoritems.txt` and find `ITEM_CUBE`
5. `Animations` has been changed to `Sounds`

title: Map Coordinate Extents too large

labels.name: Compile Error
labels.description: Something is preventing the map from compiling

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Here's a video I recorded explaining the issue (1080p recommended): https://youtu.be/_TzpHyC_0iA
I did a quick search and did not find a solution to this problem nor an issue that was open or closed. I am running PURELY VANILLA PORTAL 2 with no addons or mods other than BeeMod. I have plenty of Memory and Processing power on both ends dedicated to Portal 2.

The map is at maximum length but not width or height as shown in the video above ^
This probably isn't a bug with BeeMod but I just wanted to be double sure since I've made max-size maps before on an older PC in Vanilla portal and it worked just fine.

TL;DR: I don't know what's causing this because this same chamber was working perfectly fine before on the same date. Plz Fix.
Edit: Grammar Improvements

title: BEE2 no longer properly handles Tag intermediate compiler

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
<!--
If this is your first time opening an issue here, please read the contributing guidelines (there's a link below this text box). Remember:
- Make sure you're in the right place - item or style issues should go on BEE2-items
- Perform a search to make sure this issue hasn't already been reported
- Do not use the issue tracker to ask questions
- Issues should not be combined, unless they are very closely related (e.g. two bugs with a specific item in a specific case)
-->

<!-- Specify the version of BEE2.4 you were using when this bug occurred. -->
**BEE2 version:** 4.39.2, experienced as far back as 4.36.1

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the bug. -->
**Description of the bug:** Aperture Tag uses its own precompiler by default, which enables paint in all maps. However, BEE2 does not handle this correctly, renaming the Tag precompiler to `vbsp_original.exe` and overwriting the real compiler entirely. This then causes an infinite loop when compiling maps as the Tag compiler continuously opens copies of itself.

This definitely used to work correctly, because I was able to build Tag maps with BEE2 back in 2016 or so and didn't have to go out of my way to fix the compilers.

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
**Expected behavior:** The Tag precompiler should be renamed to `vbsp_tag` or something, with the real VBSP being left untouched.

<!-- Explain the steps taken to reproduce the bug. -->
**Steps to reproduce:** Export BEE2 to Aperture Tag, then try to compile a map. Be warned that this may cause extreme lag on your system as infinite copies of the Tag precompiler open.

title: Play sounds not working on Windows 7 and 8.1

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
The "play sounds" option is always disabled on Windows 7 and 8.1. The reason for the app crash that is now solved (file does not start with RIFF, and issue https://github.com/BEEmod/BEE2.4/issues/1521) was caused due that the OGG-format sound files are very problematic on Windows 7 and 8.1 systems.

**The solution for this is replacing the OGG sound files with WAVE-format sound files which still have the .ogg extension while the internal format is WAVE, this brings way better OS support for 7/8.1 and then the app not only will not gonna crash, but sounds will work fine**

![Play sounds always disabled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12244376/132522385-0b3f1eef-18cf-4a43-85f1-3a4852c034d7.png)

Credit for this solution goes to @Lieutenant-L-T-Smash:
"As a workaround until this issue is fixed, replace the "sounds" folder inside the main BEE folder with the one from this archive:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pUYiGqulmzkM79fd63imq6tZityFDswa/view"

title: Randomly generated textures are inconsistent between builds

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
The random textures used to be consistent given the dimensions of the map, so you would get a consistent look that could be customized by placing hidden voxels. Now, you get a new arrangement every time you compile. This wouldn't be so bad if you could preview what you get before you publish, but you can't.

The current workarounds are:
- Intercept the upload with your preferred BSP before the final confirmation
- Publish. Subscribe. Play. Delete. Republish.

I'd like to suggest a "lock texture seed" button or something in the app.

Maybe someone as picky as me just needs to use Hammer, idk. But sometimes there's one grimy tile where it just doesn't make sense!

title: Teach config files to use Windows environment variables

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
I add my BEEMOD2 configurations to Git repositories along with the map files, so I can always jump to a map and edit it with the correct configuration, however there is one setting that has an absolute path that would make it impossible to use the exact same configuration on another machine / user.

In `%APPDATA%\BEEMOD2\config\compile.cfg` there is this bit of configuration:
```ini
[Screenshot]
loc = C:\Users\Username\AppData\Roaming\BEEMOD2\screenshot.jpg
```
In order to make it work independently of my machine / user, I changed this to
```ini
[Screenshot]
loc = %APPDATA%\BEEMOD2\screenshot.jpg
```
but that would then throw an exception, because apparently the config parser does not take Windows environment variables into account (`%APPDATA%` would usually resolve to `C:\Users\Username\AppData\Roaming`).

Here's the error report:
```
---------------------------
BEE2 Error!
---------------------------
An error occurred: 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "F:\Git\BEE2.4\src\BEE2_launch.pyw", line 50, in <module>
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 961, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 950, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 655, in _load_unlocked
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\.virtualenvs\BEE2\lib\site-packages\PyInstaller\loader\pyimod03_importers.py", line 627, in exec_module
  File "F:\Git\BEE2.4\src\BEE2.py", line 7, in <module>
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 961, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 950, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 655, in _load_unlocked
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\.virtualenvs\BEE2\lib\site-packages\PyInstaller\loader\pyimod03_importers.py", line 627, in exec_module
  File "F:\Git\BEE2.4\src\UI.py", line 31, in <module>
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 961, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 950, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 655, in _load_unlocked
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\.virtualenvs\BEE2\lib\site-packages\PyInstaller\loader\pyimod03_importers.py", line 627, in exec_module
  File "F:\Git\BEE2.4\src\CompilerPane.py", line 100, in <module>
  File "F:\Git\BEE2.4\src\BEE2_config.py", line 185, in get_val
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36-32\lib\configparser.py", line 1231, in __getitem__
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36-32\lib\configparser.py", line 797, in get
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36-32\lib\configparser.py", line 393, in before_get
  File "C:\Users\Spencer Brown\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36-32\lib\configparser.py", line 443, in _interpolate_some
configparser.InterpolationSyntaxError: '%' must be followed by '%' or '(', found: '%APPDATA%\\BEEMOD2\\screenshot.jpg'
```

Can we add support for Windows environment variables here? (it doesn't even need to *save* it with `%APPDATA%` upon selecting a new one, that could be handled manually even).

title: Antline caused crash

labels.name: Can't Fix
labels.description: Bug/feature is hardcoded and cannot be changed.

body:
I managed to repeat this a couple times while working on a map. Basically, I had two buttons connected to an OR gate (The visible type) and that gate connected to 4-5 panels, aligned in such a way that I'd have three to four antlines on a surface, in such a way that connected objects placed on opposite sides of the map would have an antline that would try to cross over that surface, tested with a laser receiver and a cube dropper; this will immediately proceed to crash and close the game.

I believe it's something with the antlines, because when changing the connection display to 'signage', and connecting the two objects, my map didn't crash, but when I changed it back to 'antline', the game closed on the spot. 

From my testing I think it's caused by too many antlines on a surface and the editor unable to display them all, but I don't know how it really works to make a proper assumption on the matter. It **definitively** has something to do with antlines though.

title: Portal 1 theme textures uses portal 2 textures
Ensure triggers don't leak the map

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: Improvement or tweak to the mod

labels.name: Compiler
labels.description: Issue pertains to the custom BEE compilers

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Triggers currently have their origins placed at the center of the brush. As a result, a setup like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19228201/81462185-8a864080-9165-11ea-998e-560b5347cf91.png)
Places the origin outside the map, causing a leak:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19228201/81462202-98d45c80-9165-11ea-8d49-0e60c748a40f.png)
All maps have a nodraw box placed at `-2400 0 0`, containing various compiler-generated ents. This would be a suitable position for trigger origins.

And yes, this is a BEE2.4 issue, since the resizeable trigger logic is located in the compiler. Also yes, the thin chamber walls are a part of the new tiling system. No more 128x cubes!

title: BEE2 does not support block comments, causing compile errors

labels.name: Compile Error
labels.description: Something is preventing the map from compiling

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
BEE2.4 and its compilers do not recognize block comments (`/*` and `*/`) in configuration files. Portal 2 does, however, and Valve uses them in the material `materials/models/props/ball_catcher_sheet.vmt`. This causes a compile error if High Energy Pellet Catchers are used in an Overgrown map, since they use this texture.
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "vrad.py", line 861, in <module>
  File "vrad.py", line 790, in main
  File "F:\Git\srctools\srctools\packlist.py", line 633, in eval_dependencies
  File "F:\Git\srctools\srctools\packlist.py", line 699, in _get_material_files
  File "F:\Git\srctools\srctools\vmt.py", line 122, in parse
  File "srctools\_tokenizer.pyx", line 251, in srctools._tokenizer.Tokenizer.__call__
  File "srctools\_tokenizer.pyx", line 293, in srctools._tokenizer.Tokenizer.next_token
srctools.tokenizer.TokenSyntaxError: Single slash found, instead of two for a comment (//)!
Error occurred on line 4, with file "materials/models/props/ball_catcher_sheet.vmt".
```

title: Bee2.4 can no longer be open because "vcruntime140.dll" is no longer available at the "bin" folder of the application since the Pre-release 32...

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Bee2.4 can no longer be open because "vcruntime140.dll" is no longer available at the "bin" folder of the application. This was a library that was always present until PRL32 came out which from that point, it was no longer there... 

This issue maybe only affects windows 7 users, but including the library must be considered anyways.

title: Tractor Beam doesn't resolve activation and polarity controls separately in certain styles.
body:
Observations:

I just started using BEEMOD 2.4.0pr30 for Portal 2, and I've found what appears to be a bug. As the title says, the issue is with the Tractor Beam object, and the issue only occurs when using certain thematic styles.

It seems that the tractor beam assets used in specific styles are incorrectly ANDing all inputs of any type to the "Change active state" input, rather than treating "Change active state" and "Change polarity" as different sets of inputs.

I've tried different settings, such as switching between Bendy and Chell, changing the palette back to "Portal 2", and having my cat give the game a Stare of Death®, but the only setting that seems to affect this behavior is the style.

Bugged Styles:

  1. Overgrown
  2. Portal 1
  3. 1950s Old Aperture
  4. 1960s Old Aperture
  5. 1970s Old Aperture

(1950/1960 appear to use the same asset. Overgrown, Portal 1, and 1970 each uses its own asset.)

Working Styles:

  1. Behind the Scenes
  2. Clean
  3. Original Clean
  4. 1980s Old Aperture

(These all appear to use the same asset.)

To replicate:

  1. Use BEEMOD to set the style to Overgrown.
  2. Export and launch Portal 2.
  3. Create a new test chamber using the in-game editor.
  4. Add a tractor beam to the level.
  5. Add two pedestal buttons to the level. Set both of them to 5-second timers.
  6. Connect the first pedestal button to the tractor beam, selecting "Change active state".
  7. Connect the second pedestal button to the tractor beam, selecting "Change polarity".
  8. Start the level and press just the first pedestal button. Nothing happens.
  9. Press just the second pedestal button. Nothing happens.
  10. Press both buttons within the 5-second timer. The tractor beam activates blue.

To see the correct behavior:

  1. Save the test chamber from above, then close the game.
  2. Use BEEMOD to change the style to Clean.
  3. Export and relaunch Portal 2.
  4. Open the test chamber saved above, then start the level.
  5. Press just the first button. The tractor beam activates blue.
  6. Press just the second button. Nothing happens.
  7. Press both buttons within the 5-second timer. The tractor beam activates blue with the first button, then reverses to orange with the second button (or just activates to orange if you press in the opposite order).

title: Can't change polarity of funnel.

labels.name: Compile Error
labels.description: Something is preventing the map from compiling

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
So I went back to an old map I made in the past with beeMod and it wouldn't compile giving this error at the end of the red text: 

`ValueError: Excursion Funnel "tb1323624" has inputs, but no valid types!`

When I removed the connection to the funnel, it compiled just fine but made the puzzle impossible obviously. I tried all the button types to no avail. Also tried deleting the funnel and putting a new one in.

title: Entry And Exit Glitches
body:
Whenever I try to load/build my own map or play one of my own maps It'll load fine, but the entry and exit areas will be all screwed up and make It impossible to get into the map without using noclip. I have tried setting the entry as "entry door" instead of "elevator" and many other options but the glitch will still occur.

Screenshots:
![preview0002](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24628416/30197110-b361a940-9433-11e7-8c6d-89d2d548f209.jpg)

title: Missing FGD files causes everything to be at map origin
body: I have created a map with vanilla editor. Today I downloaded BEE 2.4 and added few triggers and changed some settings (music, voice and skybox). I have 5-10 FPS and there are glitching screams of turrets all the time. What's happening? How can I fix this?

title: BEE 2.4 (PR26) Build error with standard items (fresh install)
body:
I have fresh install of portal 2 & BEE2.4 (PR26)  (PR25 also tested)

When creating a new chamber i am able to add and compile/play some of the new objects for example the Sendificator. But for some of the basic assets like weighted buttons, i get a build error. For example just a basic room with just one button fails to compile. I have followed the install notes exactly, coped across packaged and check all currently open similar issues to no avail.

any assistance on this would be of great help.

title: Preplaced repulsion gel splats issue.

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Using the 50's aperture aesthetic, i was attempting to make a repulsion gel test. I wanted to fill in the bottom of two pits with preplaced repulsion gel, without dispensers. Every time i loaded the level on fast setting one splat or so would be missing, howeve when i tried to post it, the whole game would urn black and stop working fo r a bit and then finish posting the chamber. When I load it up after it being posted, a lot of splats would be mising from the pits, and sometimes the pink and black no texture texture would appear all over the chamber. It's one of the most annoying things i've ever delt with, but that's neither here nor there. Here's the error that appears constantly seemingly in association with this issue.

title: Singleplayer Overgrown not playable

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
I'm trying to use the the Overgrown stlye with PR26: I set the style to Overgrown, and set music, voice, etc. to the suggested values. I used the first option for both the entrance and the exit corridors, but I get the same problem with basically any corridor. I've only tried the test chamber using the in-game preview, so I didn't actually export the test chamber to the workshop. I used Full lighting.

On entrance, I see this: 
![20170716184640_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3792978/28249557-559dbeca-6a58-11e7-91d9-fc6604b953d5.jpg)
I can pass through that door, but still it's quite a visual bug.

The exit looks like this:
![20170716184705_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3792978/28249573-9971c682-6a58-11e7-83d4-b87db1f6c9b0.jpg)
The doorframe looks misplaced, and because of this, I cannot actually exit the chamber.
![20170716184725_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3792978/28249575-aab12bc2-6a58-11e7-97c4-c2d553802757.jpg)

The chamber is basically the blank just-started-the-editor one, I only placed the exit door a bit higher and added a hard-light bridge to make it accessible.

title: BEE 2.4 PRL25 CRASH!!! "PermissionError: [WinError 5] Zugriff veweigert: ´d:\\program files (x86\\steam\\steamapps\\common\\portal2\\sdk_content\\maps\\instances\\bee2\\50s\\items\\bee\\drawbridge ´

labels.name: App Crash
labels.description: Something is causing the app to crash

body:
Originally posted by @Flo2912 (https://github.com/BEEmod/BEE2-items/issues/2081)

![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19980844/27710033-8b911398-5d1e-11e7-839f-df2237f37408.png)

"I get this Error everytime I try to export something with Bee 2.4 Pre 26 to Portal 2, had the same issue with Pre 24 as well. It seems that trying to export it breaks the folder that is named in the issu, since I can't open thix folder anymore, nor can I delet or rename it. When I restart my Computer, the folder is vanished and reapperas after the next export try, however than anoter folder takes its place of disfunction and it crashes again. And older version of Bee 2 seemed to work well, while it allways got an "Can't create File that already exists" error, so I had to unpack the packages all by myself (Only knew where to pack items and resources, as result it worked but hat some things like voice-lines missing), however since I startet pre26 this old application version doesn't want to launch at all. "

3. It's possible to get stuck in a vactube occasionally and be forced to restart/noclip out

title: Goo bug, panel error and a question

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Hello, I am using the BEE2.4 Pre release 25 and Item packages currently.
I have stumbled across the following issue.
Using the Overgrown style and editing my maps ingame the goo pits sometimes get a graphical issue.
When actually playing the map you can no only see through the world (whatever is below it for example) and by looking at it it turns birght white. After first encounter with this issue I have only been able to get rid of it by using another style or reinstalling Portal 2 and the mod. I can upload pictures if required.
Secondly, I am not sure if this issue has been stated before but the glass panel in the overgrown style shows up as an error ingame for people playing the map besides me.
To get to my question, is it possible to implement items of the Bee2 mod in Bee2.4 (I remember for example a big light source in form of sun cracking through the roof in the overgrown style for example) ? If so, how ? 
Thank you for any help in advance!

title: Glass Futbol receivers cause "map coordinates too large" issue

labels.name: Compile Error
labels.description: Something is preventing the map from compiling

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body: Trying to make a puzzle with the glass futbol when I found out any futbol sockets set to receive a futbol instead of spawning one (auto-drop first cube disabled) cause Portal 2 to refuse to finish compiling the chamber. After I press F9, the three bars that appear before the final loading of the map fill completely and the black loading screen with the Aperture logo and the 15 little dots in the bottom of the right appears, but after two of those dots fill (always exactly two) the screen will turn black and fade into the screen again, however no dots will turn blue (at least in the first fifteen minutes of waiting). In the developer console messages will appear saying a few UGC files didn't load correctly, and the map's coordinates extend too far. Both before and after attempting to compile the puzzle, the single futbol socket set to spawn a futbol (auto-drop first cube enabled) worked fine and no compile issues occurred, and the respawn cube checkbox didn't have an effect either way. However no matter what amount of receiving futbol sockets were in the map (tried every number from one to four), it would not properly compile as the loading screen wouldn't progress past that same point.  There were a few other items in the map that I'm not sure whether or not they contribute to the problem: reversed funnel, pellet launcher and two pellet catchers, small signage set to option 7 (exit door), cold light strips and square cold lights, and a few fizzlers. Not entirely sure why this happens and couldn't find a simple fix...

title: I found a bug
body:
After having problems to export to Portal 2 i tried many things. I have reinstalled steam, Portal 2 and several times Beemod until i found out how simple it is to solve the problem.
Now i saw that i'm not the only one with this problem and i thought i should make a post about it.
This is the overall problem: https://github.com/BEEmod/BEE2.4/issues/564
Beemod is not able to export because a programm is currently using it.

After installing a programm that should unlock the folder i saw that igfxEM.exe is using it. After a quick google search i realized that this is a preinstalled programm made by Intel. 

When i stopped it with the Task Manager everything worked fine.

I also deleted igfxEM.exe cause it is not needed. 

I don't know if this happens with other programms too, but if you can't export, even if Portal 2 is not running, download a Unlocker and check what programm is causing the problems.

I used Lockhunter to find the problem: http://lockhunter.com/?ver=3.1.1.115&vertype=pro&sm=main_window_64&mode=&keystart=&keyend=

If you are worried about Viruses here is the Virustotal search: https://www.virustotal.com/de/file/adea78761f18baaf938f9b5a18ee3b07cb6426f8adfa234f715630741130ee7d/analysis/1491463208/

I hope this helps

title: [Game Crash] Gel on BTS Buttons(?)

labels.name: App Crash
labels.description: Something is causing the app to crash

body: I converted [one of my older maps](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=545151069) to a Wheatley style via BeeMod's BTS style. At one point in the map, you can get gel into an excursion funnel, where it can be carried through an emancipation grill and onto (what was in clean style) a pedestal button (now a red "elevator button"). The game immediately crashed. Perhaps the new button type does not have a "painted" skin?

title: BEE2.4 sometimes bugging on launch
body:
I have been using the items development version for quite some time now. But just after syncing the latest version, BEE2 will no longer work. After loading, only the log window will appear. The BEE2.4 window is open, but minimized, and cannot be un-minimized. Here was a screenshot I managed to get of the preview popup:
![beemod2point4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19228201/21618797/8e8de9a8-d1a1-11e6-9264-d53d61f69753.png)
BEEMOD Palette appears to be selected, but that was *not* the last palette I used or exported.

Btw. I have opened the issue here even though I am using the items development version since it is an issue with the program itself.

EDIT: I've been unable to figure out what causes this, although deleting the config folder temporarily fixes the problem. Additionally, the palette shown in the image isn't the BEEMOD palette - notice the Cube Coloriser and Half Panel at the end of the palette.

EDIT 2: Specifically, deleting the `config.cfg` file fixes the problem.

EDIT 3: Even more specifically, deleting the Window State section will make BEE2 work again.

UPDATE 2: Resizing Style Properties at all will fix it.

title: Delayer Not Working?

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
Hey I am having troubles with the delayer object.

What is suppose to happen is I have two connected to each other, the first one waits 4 seconds and then holds power for 3 seconds. But the first delayer never fires any output to the next delayer. It works the first time I try it but then it breaks for no reason and no matter how many times I delete these from the level and replace them in the world they won't trigger any outputs ever again.

The weird thing though is that I have a bunch of delayers on the opposite side of the map doing the exact same thing because they are clones of the same mechanic I am making so it must just be the cubes I am working inside of that affect these delayers?

Any information anyone has on this please let me know! Thank you>

EDIT: I made a video to demonstrate what happens for me:
🔗 https://youtu.be/5um0vHxPb6I
Awesome mod except for this one part! Thank you so much for making this! 😃

title: [Bug] Panels "screaming" and bugging in old aperture maps

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
I recently made a map in 60s style, where the main things used were angled panels and various gels. I was unable to make the test quite how I wanted it to be, because whenever I activated an angled panel with a button, they would stay activated, even after removing myself of the cube used to push the button. Occasionally, when pressing and unpressing a button several times, they'd return to the original state, but most of the time they would just stay active after being activated the first time. In addition to that, the panels would make a horrible "screaming" noise whenever activated, the first "scream" being heard out at the elevator when the panels set to start activated would activate. This behavior seems to be present in all the old aperture styles.

I've now remade the chamber with Beemod 2.2.5, where the panels do not "scream", and return to their original state when buttons stop being pressed.

This behavior should be addressed in a later version of Beemod 2.4.

title: Big music issue (Dr Kleiner error) and more

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
BEE 2.4 have a major issue that affects musics. I already know what musics are getting error in any style. Tests get so boring with the same music or when get the error and all chamber becomes silent.

The musics that are getting error are the musics that have the following characteristics, you probably know what is this:
http://i.imgur.com/mojJcAS.png

If the music have these three extra playback sounds, you will get a Dr. Kleiner ("Oh fiddlesticks, what now?" from half life 2) error, but only when PUBLISHING, not reconstructing the chamber.

The console error: 
http://i.imgur.com/plMrUnG.png
(Note the wheatley error, some lines from wheatley isn't playing when exit the testchamber.)

Well, you have to choice only that type of music:
http://i.imgur.com/eKw7tdv.png

I'm getting back to the BEE 2.2.5. I love both, both have unique options, for example, the fast rendering without pressing CTRL button when render, but BEE 2.2.5 are glitching with me while rendering and some skybox and ilumination are glitching for me on deadly goo. I want so bad these things fixed in Bee 2.4, and please, put the addons of the 2.2.5 on the 2.4, I love the celling light on bee 2.2.5, give so much detail.

title: Broken Markdown Descriptions

labels.name: Done
labels.description: This has been addressed in the next release

body:
In Pr21, you switched over to using Markdown for descriptions. However, the 1970s the formatting is broken so the bullet points are messed up:

Underground orange gel enrichment sphere from 1975, now for testing homeless people in exchange for $60.
This is when they started using more random colours and materials on their walls, and ceilings are different.
Buttons are no longer recessed into holes in the floor. _Modern white indicator signs are now used, in the form of semi-transparent stencils_. Lights are now white, and the fog is grey.\* The glass looks better, and stairs are no longer made of grating.

This is probably in other descriptions too.

title: Music Names
body: Not a biggie, but the music "TEST" and "FrankenTurrets" have the name of each other.

title: Retractable Pedestal Button Issue
body:
I was using a re-tractable pedestal button in my map as a fail safe if the user does something so they can revert back to the previous.  I.E. if a cube gets stuck on a weighted button, the pedestal will come out the wall and offer the user a way to fizzle the cube.

I updated to the latest version / packages of BEE last night and it seems that pedestal buttons are now broken, as my mechanic no longer works.  To replicate, I setup a simple chamber (https://imgur.com/LItIJlh).  What should happen (IMO) I stand on the floor button, the button comes out the ground, I step off the button, the button goes into the ground (or when it's powered it's up, when it's not it's down).  However the latter no longer happens.  

I do have a feeling however that it is trying to use the timer in some way, as if I jump repetidly on the button, it eventually goes back into the ground.  I tried adjusting the timer duration and when I lowered it, it seem to take less jumps to get it to go back in the ground.

Please let me know if you need anymore information to look into this or if the above is not clear enough and I'll try to re-write in a clearer maner.

title: [Bug] If the Portal 2 Folder was moved, and then Bee2.4 is launched, beemod will not load anymore
body:
Once Bee2.4 was installed and got associated to the Portal 2 folder, if you move the P2 folder to another place, and then launch beemod, it will crash and will close automatically to not load anymore, it doesn´t matter if you move back the P2 folder to the original place. You will have to re-install beemod again.

This bug happens in the latest pre-relase and the previous ones too.

title: Bee 2.4 Exporting Issue
body:
So here I am, setting up palettes to create Portal 1 levels with, everything appears to be running smoothly. That is, until I hit the export button. Every time I try to export anything, Bee 2.4 gives me the following error:  "FileNotFound: FileNotFound (no such file)" 
I run a Windows 8.1 gaming PC, not a laptop. There is a similar issue to this, but it revolves around a user on a Mac. I tried re-installing the program several times, following along with various tutorials that I could find, but to no avail. Some help would be greatly appreciated. - Krunk

title: Can't export anything with: Bee2.4 Prl 17
body:
I don't know if i'm the only one experimenting with this great bug, but i must to report this, because i can't export anything to the game with this latest pre-release. 

Aditional notes: installed on a 100% clean P2 install. For beemod, uncompressed and installed on a empty folder specially made for Beemod.

---

This was my first try on the exporting process with the PRL17:

1 - As you can see, i can not click on that "Text Box" to show the bug in detail, because after that, Beemod gets immediately freeze, forever:

![bee](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12707459/8dd35602-c873-11e5-917d-214524dbbfb7.png)

2 - On my second try, as you can see, even exporting on "Default settings" it gets freeze again, forever:

![bee2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12707573/aba00378-c874-11e5-90ec-fc28c8ca2a03.png)

title: Bee2.4 PRL16: Bug List (Includes Screenshots).
body:
Using the Shpere Button in Overgrown style causes error when trying to compile:

![2016-01-06_00012](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155381/8827087c-b4a3-11e5-9c03-6452d7759b46.jpg)

---

Cameras are literally "Dead" in the Entry and Exit SP Doors in Overgrown Style: 

![2016-01-06_00014](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155558/9027ad46-b4a4-11e5-8f04-caf22e9ac677.jpg)
![2016-01-06_00013](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155566/978caab4-b4a4-11e5-93dd-b664d59af9bf.jpg)

---

The Half Wall and its variations are completely vulnerable to portals shots:

![2016-01-06_00007](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155674/4ebf7586-b4a5-11e5-9844-ac371e9985cc.jpg)
![2016-01-06_00001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156136/ee2a5b02-b4a7-11e5-8167-5b4a03abb0ce.jpg)
![2016-01-06_00015](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155697/6351b00e-b4a5-11e5-8a10-f16e3c1a5a05.jpg)

---

Failure when trying to compile in Co-op mode only in: 50 & 60 Aperture Styles:

![builderror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12155848/3fdba340-b4a6-11e5-9ae6-c98cbf2e9323.jpg)

---

Wrong effect placement on the custom fizzlers on all the Old Aperture Styles:

![2016-01-06_00009](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156052/5a3eca22-b4a7-11e5-9943-933fb843470a.jpg)
![2016-01-06_00011](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156060/69e744d6-b4a7-11e5-8333-107cd56aa12a.jpg)

---

Missing Skybox in the final of the exit door in Old aperture style:

![2016-01-06_00016](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156312/045cdb2e-b4a9-11e5-8c8f-d1b9217b08e4.jpg)

---

Wrong placement of the stripes in the little windows:

![2016-01-06_00005](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156346/47809670-b4a9-11e5-84fa-4e3d0cbe1f12.jpg)

---

Im not sure if this bug is fixeable but Doors and Lasers Relays got "Dark Orange" when shots with Reflection gel:

![2016-01-06_00002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156434/bb720fa0-b4a9-11e5-8c15-c9228ab7e9ac.jpg)

---

Two suggestions:
1. Reduce the Warm Light Brightness or add options to choose the bridghtness level through "Button Type"

![2016-01-06_00003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/12156619/bdd88ac0-b4aa-11e5-9ce7-ec2166ea91fa.jpg)

title: Portal 2 can't make anything with BEE2.4
body:
Portal 2 seems to have this error when I installed BEE2.4, this happened to me in Windows 8 and 10. No matter what style, option, pallete I use, it doesn't work. And in Windows 10, I got BEE 2 right when I installed portal 2, then the same error happened. I export the pallete, it successfully exports, it asks me if I want to launch portal 2, I said yes. Then I built the map, then error. I don't really know what is going on. It says the VBSP failed, like in a previous problem. In the windows 8, I used VBSP and VRAD didn't work, I did VRAD and then VBSP failed, and I can't do both.

Does anybody got a fix?

title: Bee2.4 Prl14 Bugs
body:
I tested all styles and here are the bugs ive found on this Pre release. 
I had to scrap Gifs in HD, and some detailed rendered videos due to github limitations (10 MB seems to be the file limit here). 

---

 Wrong particles on the Reflection gel. The new restored Reflection gel looks very good, congrats!!

![reflection gel wrong particles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611040/8f5f8832-9b97-11e5-8715-a5cbe3a9e880.jpg)
![reflection gel wrong particles2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611045/b8b6ea54-9b97-11e5-85e4-ffe1dc971c5f.jpg)

---

Converting glass to grating or just using the standalone grating from Bee 2.4 always causes " There was an error building the chamber" on all the Styles:

![grating](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11610931/6f2f885a-9b92-11e5-9141-ccde74da1e2f.gif)

---

This happens only in Clean Style:

![2015-12-05_00007](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611109/4b46242c-9b9b-11e5-8a11-46717eefe2d2.jpg)
![2015-12-05_00006](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611110/55d72012-9b9b-11e5-9836-24a6854c3551.jpg)
![low ilumination on sp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611117/9fd39c5e-9b9b-11e5-99b3-436ba75b69bf.jpg)

---

Wall becomes translucent when placing a light closely to a fizzler in P1 Style:

![wall translucid when placing a light 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611122/1e7772ba-9b9c-11e5-9401-f43f6269e833.jpg)
Just an observation, Buildcubemaps mode is disabled in P1 Style coop preview:
![buildcubemaps mode disable in coop preview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611135/6f593f92-9b9c-11e5-8daf-6f6527fdd136.jpg)

When editing a map and change the SP to Co-op property causes "error building the chamber" but only on the following Styles: BTS,  50´s, 60´s and 70´s:
![when changing sp to coop map](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611146/c15b263e-9b9c-11e5-9f57-61cc45213854.jpg)

---

Wrong Effect placement on the custom fizzlers in all the Old Aperture Styles:

![asfasfasfasfasfasfasf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611177/9d1ab7ba-9b9e-11e5-8734-125ae2878eae.png)
The only special fizzler wich displays effects in the correct possition in the Old Styles:

![the only special fizzler effects displaying in the correct possition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611187/36d70fde-9b9f-11e5-8104-51b968eac180.jpg)

---

Bug causing looking black in some sections of the Antlines in the 70´s Old Style:
![antline broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611197/ae658544-9b9f-11e5-811f-6693ccc4400c.jpg)

80´s Style uses Clean antlines and buttons:
![2015-12-05_00018](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/11611206/4d2733d0-9ba0-11e5-855b-a3ef14ca6536.jpg)

---

title: Bee2.4 Pr10 Bugs
body:
Hello, i would like to share the bugs ive found using the Pre-release 10 to contribute a bit on its development. Most of bugs are In-game, but there is one on the tool interface.

In-game bugs:
Reflection gel does not reflect lazer, and is missing texture in Clean style:
![2015-09-27_00001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125850/3ed450e2-6559-11e5-9dd2-fbb6325eca22.jpg)

Antlines are missing textures:
![2015-09-27_00002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125875/5adcf9d2-655a-11e5-824b-e5c628fa7097.jpg)

Dragging one of the custom fizzlers to the map causes an unexpected close (its random, does not happen in a certain type of the customs series). The gif may take several seconds to work depending on the speed connection:

![gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125897/f11e9f0e-655a-11e5-8be4-4ca59bfe8ffe.gif)

A strange bug causing disastrous positions on the Large observation and in Coop Spawn when using the "Unlock defaul items" option in the interface tool :

![2015-09-27_00005](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125972/3c549152-655d-11e5-9b8e-0bbed93fefea.jpg)

![2015-09-27_00006](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125980/be10319c-655d-11e5-8e84-684c8e69df75.jpg)

Here are the rendered results of the bug:
![2015-09-27_00007](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10125982/c60e9afa-655d-11e5-9941-4fda81efb676.jpg)

All types of invisible Logic Gates, the antline magnet, Coop checkpoints, SR Latch and both Intupts,  are unusable in Clean style, when you try to use, this is the result:
![29417d66-3167-11e5-9612-61ee02c58b02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10126017/3b9e2196-655e-11e5-98ac-ede5bdce49a1.jpg)

Not sure if this bug (Show BEE triggers in preview mode) is the interface tool fault, or is just the game not recognizing the exported resource:
![asfasfasfasfasfsf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10126149/4c07c056-6562-11e5-98e0-6cfa1a845800.jpg)

This is the interface tool bug (Click to view in full resolution):
![asfasf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244376/10126168/d02bf83e-6562-11e5-9f91-4d3f11db2941.jpg)

Thats all the bugs ive noticed for now. 

I would like to have a little option on the tool box to export default textures on the Clean Style in future pre releases :)

You are doing an amazing job on the Bee 2.4 development, keep it up !!!

body:
Hello there !

- Coop mode compiling still does not work if used with ovegrown style.

title: Various issues I found for now
body:
Hello !

As you can see, I try to be really active for helping you with this mod, and I thank you to spend time on it !
So far, here are the various bugs I have encountered : 
- Impossible to build a coop map with Overgrown and BTS styles (an error has occured while compiling. Tested even without 0 item added on the map, just the coop map option checked in the PTI)
- the normal fizzler does not trigger with any input on Overgrown style, even if u start it as not active, it will be active in the preview, and will never change it state.
- the exit level in BTS style is buggy. You need to cross a very dark room to find the final exit door in the exit area.
- The pneumatic diversity vent need to get the box unchecked for portable on the attached floor to be able to get a portable floor.

For now thats all I reported. I will edit this topic if I find anything else.

Thx

title: Bee2.4 Pr7 Bugs
body:
Hello, I have always found Bee editor as a very useful tool to make high quality maps. For that reason I would like to contribute listing the bugs ive found on the last pre release of Bee2.4 (Prl 7)
First of all i will clarify that I did a 100% clean install of P2 before using the last Pre release.

Lets start listing the InGame bugs first:

When i used items like: Coop checkpoints, Set/reset latch, logic gates (And, Or, Not)
the game always gives the clasic build error:

title: BEE 4.0pr6 Bugs
body:
Alright. Before I get there. I keep getting a error on the program. Once I open BEE, it just gives me a weird error.

Bugs : 
- Still couldn't publish maps. Some items are causing this like COOP Checkpoints.
- New items don't work
- Random Portal Crashes. (Connected a trigger to a stair) (Confirmed, it does crash)
- Once on a different style. Most of the styles don't work with coop (Probably, didn't make the styles for them, like overgrown)
- On overgrown style (Probably on others) I see a timer with a missing texture. Like the frame of the timer is missing texture. (Also the other indicator panels do that)
- Still some goo glitches and door. The goo is all messed up. And once the doors at the start open. The round thingies go and disappear. You know the circles in the middle of the doors.
- The killer fizzler(The red one) Has a weird red holder. 
- On overgrown (And maybe others) The glass and grating is a Player Clip texture, And you can place portals on the grating.
- Still missing icons in editor
- Missing models, aka blue error in editor.
- COOP checkpoints and other items, block the player to play their puzzle

How to fix the error, once opening the bee
Watch this video carefully.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G3fNQJ2c_KM&feature=youtu.be

title: Bee2.4pr5 bugs
body:
I am a big fan of your mod and I found some bugs yesterday.
- [x] Placing a gel splat causes a combiler error (can't find instance)
- [x] Overgrown style and BTS can't find style instances and gives combile error
- [ ] Wheatley voice doesn't work
- [ ] BSOD elevator video doesn't work, just black screen

That's really it for bugs. All P2 items and all BEE items seem to work so far, and the catwalks are amazing! Great Job!

title: BEE 4.0pr5 Bugs
body:
It's getting better and better everyday. But I got to tell you the bugs so the program gets better every day/week/month/year. And thank you for the amazing mod. I hope this mod gets popular once. Because the editor might not get those items. Anyway bugs are listed below
- Some icons still missing in-game editor, but the items work fine (Also the default items that have 3 images in one icon has also missing checkerbox.)
- Catwalk and some other ones missing models in the editor
- Styles like Overgrown or Behind The Scenes blocks the user playing their test chamber with a error.
  - Style : Overgrown - Stopping the user to play their test chamber
  - Music : Random PETI
  - Voice : GLaDOS (Clean) - Her voice doesn't play
  - Skybox : Black aka Darkness
  - Elev Vid : Black AKA No video.
- If P1 style (I Think) The observation room appears as a blue error aka missing model.
- Voices do not play.
- Logic Gates cause a error, once trying to play game.
- Goo gets glitched sometimes. (E.X. [Image](http://imgur.com/uFOsLGA))  
- Using the normal beemod set. And once published. The map gives me a error.
  That's all I can find. If I spot any other bugs. I will add them here.
  I understand this is the _Pre-Release_ of this new program. But I am letting the developers to look out of those bugs, that are listed above.

title: bug fix suggestions for next pre release
body:
lets get these bugs hammered out before the next pre release
- get the menu for the voice line selector working and get voices into tests
- get the video chooser working properly
- fix leaks in elevators and corridors that are preventing clean tests from being published
- get the Overgrown style working and able to compile a empty new test chamber without error
- if you can in the next pre release, get the BTS style working and able to compile a empty new test chamber without error.
- begin work on in test chamber bottomless pits.

title: Weird CheckerBox Icons and other
body:
So I choose my own items. Styles and voice. And I export it. For e.x. yea?
So I go to the InGame editor. And I get some weird checkerbox icons in my items menu. So I don't place anything down. And I play the test chamber. And I get a error, meaning I can't play my test chamber. So I place a item down, and it is still the same error I got.

Did I place BEE 4.0.4 in a wrong place? If so. Tell me, and I will again try to do this. And if this happens again, once I placed it to the right place in the files. Where you guys tell me. It is most likely a bug.

Thanks.

title: Bug: Game gives test chamber build error with new version of bee2
body: Bug: Game gives test chamber build error when using clean style in new version of bee2

title: Duplicating item in palette menu
body:
Sometimes clicking on an item multiple times in the outgoing palette, duplicates the item, especially if you then click on another item
I've also noticed this happens when I pick up an item, and instead of getting the "moving item" image I get a duplicate of an item behind it

title: Compile options title is cutoff
body: Compile Options menu cant be resized, and the title is cutoff because of how small it is

title: The filters get cut off
body:
Problem: The filters get cut off
Possible solution: let the menu extend as far as it needs to to the right, even off the interface

title: Dragging over and back removes item
body: If you pick up an item that exists on the palette already. Drag the item over the palette, then back over the bucket, the item is removed from the palette
